page.title: 15MELBOURNE'S ENVIRONMENT
page.content: THE AREA AROUND MELBOURNE IS GENTLY UNDULATING WITH A MAXIMUM HEIGHT OF 125 METRES ABOVE SEA LEVEL.SOME CONIFEROUS AND DECIDUOUS WOODLAND ARE PRESENT.HOWEVER,THE MAIN LAND USE IS CROP PRODUCTION.EARLY VEGETABLES ARE GROWN ON THE LOAMY WELL DRAINED SOILS. PASTURE TENDS TO OCCUR ON THE SMALL AREAS WHICH ARE POORLY DRAINED. ARTIFICIAL POOLS AND STAUNTON HAROLD RESERVOIR ARE PRESENT.THE AREA IS WELL SERVED WITH A ROAD NETWORK,ALTHOUGH THEY ARE "B" AND MINOR ROADS.A VARIETY OF NEW INDUSTRIES LIKE COMPUTER TECHNOLOGY AND PRECISION MEASURING EQUIPMENT HAVE DEVELOPED ON THE INDUSTRIAL ESTATE AND ENVIRONS OF THE TOWN CENTRE.THE PROXIMITY OF THE A38, M1 AND EAST MIDLANDS AIRPORT HAVE BEEN IMPORTANT IN MELBOURNE'S DEVELOPMENT. MELBOURNE IS A NUCLEATED COUNTRY TOWN SETTLEMENT IN A RURAL SURROUNDING AREA
